titleStmt.title: F. C. Tichener et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5396

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky
McLean County Sct.
To his Excellency,
Gov. Bramlette-

Your petitioners Would Respectfully Represent that at the September term of the MLean Circuit a fine was adjudged against W C. Moselys for keeping a tipling House. We would Respectfully Represent that said Mosely is quite a young man his parents are both dead and he is poor and Unable to pay the Judgment. and we Respectfully ask that you will Remit the Same and much Oblige &c-

F C Tichener
John Jewell
George G Jones
Eleanora Jones
D. G. Thomason
Louis L Moore
Elijah H Mosely
John W. Moore
Wm Calhoun
C. C. Mosely
G S Sharpredge
A. W. Smith
